definition: Zhuang ethnic group of Guangxi, the PRC's second most numerous ethnic group

sentences.english: Seen from a slight distance, that would make a splendid spectacle.
sentences.chinese: 從稍遠的地方看過去，它給人以一種壯麗輝煌的印象。

sentences.english: In autumn, maples turn a splendid red.
sentences.chinese: 秋季，松葉呈現出壯麗的紅色。
濟慈所作之詩雖簡潔卻不失爲壯麗。

sentences.english: The setting, at the foot of the Alps, is majestic.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾卑斯山腳的環境雄偉壯麗。

sentences.english: The  grandeur of the  Old Summer Palace is second to none.
sentences.chinese: 圓明園的壯麗是其他園林無可比擬的。

sentences.english: They saw the lofty peak in all its majesty.
sentences.chinese: 他們看到了高聳的山峯，氣勢雄偉壯麗。

sentences.english: I love you an exquisite scenery magnificent rivers and mountains.
sentences.chinese: 我愛你風光旖旎壯麗的河山。

sentences.english: Upstairs you will also find a roof garden with spectacular views of the city below.
sentences.chinese: 樓上亦設有可以欣賞到下方壯麗市景的屋頂花園。

sentences.english: Millions of people travel each year to experience nature’s splendour.
sentences.chinese: 每年有千百萬人爲領略壯麗的自然風光而旅遊。

sentences.english: The Potala stands more superb than ever in the bright sun.
sentences.chinese: 布達拉宮比過去更加壯麗地矗立在燦爛的陽光中。

sentences.english: The most miraculous, magnificent and fresh writing is usually found in the Taoist Canon.
sentences.chinese: 天下極神奇極壯麗極鮮美文字，多在道藏。

sentences.english: She was reminding him he could do nothing so flamboyant as to die with her.
sentences.chinese: 她在提醒着他無法這樣壯麗的同她殉葬。

sentences.english: Because of the beauty of the islands, the magnificent beaches Saipan have become a popular resort.
sentences.chinese: 島上的美景和壯麗的海灘使塞班成爲了一處度假勝地。

sentences.english: The coastguard cottages had a splendid view overlooking the bay.
sentences.chinese: 在海岸警衛員的小屋正好可以看得見海灣壯麗的景色。

sentences.english: The mountain is famous for its unique peaks , grotesque stones and great waterfalls.
sentences.chinese: 這座山峯以奇山，怪石和壯麗的瀑布而着稱。

sentences.english: You should really check out the magnificent view from the top of that cliff over there.
sentences.chinese: 你真應該從那個峭壁之頂來看一看這宏偉壯麗的風景。

definition: to take in the whole scene at once/to have a panoramic view
to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
